intro: Amaracarpus nouhuizii, commonly known as the Guangxi hibiscus, is a deciduous shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has palmately lobed leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
